issues.description: The problem statement / UML explicitly declares the Animal attribute 'name' as type String (problem_statement.md shows 'name: String'), but the reference solution implements this attribute as a StringBuilder (solution_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Animal.java: line 4 declares 'private StringBuilder name;'). This is an attribute type mismatch between the specification and the solution. While the solution preserves the public API (getName() returns a String), the internal type difference contradicts the UML and may confuse students who expect the attribute to be a String based on the exercise description.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the solution's Animal class use a String for the name attribute to match the UML/specification. Concretely, change the field to 'private String name;', update the constructor to assign 'this.name = name;', and adjust the setter to 'this.name = newName;'. Alternatively, update the problem statement/UML to indicate a StringBuilder if that was intentional, but preferring the former preserves the UML intent and avoids student confusion.
